result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob Michael Lach-Cook

defendant.name: Lach-Cook, Jacob Michael
defendant.address: 4567 South Whitnall Avenue,210, St Francis, WI 53235

records.addlTxt: Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION; all other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail to continue.

FOR BRANCH 15
Defendant Jacob Michael Lach-Cook in court, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Jacob Michael Lach-Cook.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for return on warrant. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court orders signature bond sets at $1500.00; Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 3 SUPERVISION. All other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail to continue. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15. Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Warrant/Capias/Commitment canceled; Bench Warrant Cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Report, filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Jacob Michael Lach-Cook.  Attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Status Conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court orders bench warrant to issue for the defendant.  The Court ordered that the defendant is to be REMANDED to the commissioner upon return on the bench warrant.  The Court ordered any bail on deposit forfeited.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jacob Michael Lach-Cook appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg appeared by video for Jacob Michael Lach-Cook.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge J.D. Watts, Branch 15.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing MAY be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/104d9737-ba2f-8811-9083-aed2135824d9
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
